image.altText: Erin Patterson Supreme Court

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Erin Patterson will face a two day pre-sentence hearing after being found guilty of murdering three relatives by serving them beef Wellingtons that contained death cap mushrooms. Follow the hearing live.

title.children: Erin Patterson's life in prison detailed as plea hearing continues

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: Police allege the South Yarra man targeted a local synagogue six times this year.

title.children: Man charged with multiple graffiti attacks on Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: Chris Flinos

props.synopsis: A crypto CEO accused of fraud in Abu Dhabi is now working at a suburban mortgage broker in Melbourne.

title.children: The collapsed crypto boss now working at a Melbourne mortgage broker

image.altText: Boundary Umpire Greta Miller throws the ball in.

props.synopsis: Over the weekend, Melissa Sambrooks, Kaitlin Barr and Greta Miller became the first ever female AFL boundary umpires.

title.children: 'Couldn't stop smiling': First female boundary umpires in AFL

image.altText: A sign outside an Aldi store

props.synopsis: Unions and some retail workers are calling on major retailers to back down on mandatory bag checks and security gates.

title.children: Staff safety concerns raised over supermarket bag checks, security gates

image.altText: A large white and red ferry comes in to dock while people in the foreground watch from a wharf.

props.synopsis: The ship will stay in Hobart for about two months, then it will be moved to Victoria until it's ready to be used on the Bass Strait crossing in a year's time.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV set for storage in Victoria after Hobart fit-out

image.altText: A police car with flashing lights blocking the road with officers standing near another car in background.

props.synopsis: A man dies in hospital after being struck by a light-coloured SUV in Coburg on Sunday night.

title.children: Police search for driver following fatal hit-and-run north of Melbourne

image.altText: Anthony Radford two (also good for generic)

props.synopsis: Community members and local authors are concerned Bendigo's reputation has been damaged following this year's Bendigo Writers Festival controversy, which resulted in more than 50 writers and hosts withdrawing.

title.children: Regional city fears reputational hit over writers' festival fallout

image.altText: Kelpie leaps over sheep

props.synopsis: A study estimates the nation's 270,000 working livestock dogs contributed to the economy at an amount similar to Australia's beef exports to the US in 2023-24.

title.children: Working dogs worth billions to the Australian economy

image.altText: An image of Jay Brady multiplied that fades into background and a car and cheques on coloured background

props.synopsis: Court documents reveal the founder of a charity behind a cancelled bushfire recovery event was described by a judge as a "sophisticated fraudster" and convicted of multiple crimes of deception under a different name.

title.children: 'Sophisticated fraudster' behind cancelled Victorian bushfire charity event

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: Online dating offers a bigger pool of potential partners, but a new study shows it can lead to less passionate, satisfying and intimate relationships.

title.children: Online dating may not be the best way to meet a partner, study shows

image.altText: An aerial view of a car accident with a damaged car and a fire truck, and firefighters.

props.synopsis: Two drivers are killed at Toolern Vale when a vehicle observed by police officers to be speeding crashed head-on into another car.

title.children: Two dead after head-on collision involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: Glass shattered on the floor of a house

props.synopsis: Three people are stabbed following an alleged home invasion in Melbourne's west, police say.

title.children: Three stabbed in home invasion in Melbourne's west

image.altText: man standing in front of a curved bar

props.synopsis: As more regional bank branches close, a new alliance is pushing back against the Big Four

title.children: Lobby group calls for levy on major banks that close regional branches

image.altText: A group of people standing on the steps of parliament. Some of them raising their fists to the air.

props.synopsis:
In a matter of weeks, the Victorian government is set to introduce a bill to legislate Australia's first formal treaty with traditional owners.

But what does that mean?

title.children: Victoria is signing a treaty — let us explain

image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: In coming weeks the Victorian government is set to introduce a bill to legislate Australia's first formal treaty with traditional owners. The ABC can reveal it's expected to give Victoria's elected Aboriginal body powers to establish new institutions — like a proposed education institute.

title.children: New details emerge as Australia's first formal Treaty imminent in Victoria

image.altText: Cars queue on a road under overcast skies.

props.synopsis: The outer Melbourne community where only 1.2 per cent of people use public transport.

title.children: 'Deliver it now': Outer suburbs councils call for new stations to ease choked roads

image.altText: Isaiah Johnson holding footy

props.synopsis: Red Cliffs Football Netball Club, in Victoria's north-west, has terminated the contract of a footballer after an alleged assault.

title.children: Victorian footballer's contract torn up after alleged assault

image.altText: Ryan Cho wears sunglasses and a surgical mask as he walks down the street. A reporter holds a microphone towards him.

props.synopsis: A trainee surgeon accused of secretly filming hundreds of women in hospital toilets and bathrooms has "complex" mental health issues, his lawyer says.

title.children: Doctor accused of filming women in hospital bathrooms granted bail

image.altText: Cute Jack russell terrier dog with a rubber toy ball inside a carrier for animals in a neutral interior.

props.synopsis: Some pet owners will soon be able to fly with their cat or dog on some domestic routes. Here's how to prepare your pet for busy airports and in-cabin flights.

title.children: Looking forward to 'pet-friendly' flights in Australia? Here’s what experts say

image.altText: A man in glasses and a shirt acts cheekily in front of the camera as he takes a seflie

props.synopsis: A teacher in regional Victoria has been charged with soliciting child abuse material, with his employer describing the alleged offending as "distressing" and "deeply concerning".

title.children: Victorian school teacher charged with soliciting child abuse material

image.altText: A laughing girl holds a young wombat above her head in a bright yellow canola field.

props.synopsis: A mother who lost her toddler son in an all-too-common farm accident turns to writing and launches a foundation to support farming families.

title.children: Rescue wombat helps grieving family find 'real joy' after son's death

image.altText: A CCTV camera attached to a wall.

props.synopsis: A national trial of CCTV cameras in hundreds of childcare centres is expected to get the green light at a meeting with federal, state and territory education ministers in Sydney today.

title.children: National CCTV trial in childcare centres expected as ministers meet

image.altText: a exterior image of a Lactalis factory with the company's logo on the wall and a sign pointing to the entrance

props.synopsis: Global dairy business Lactalis is set to purchase New Zealand dairy company Fonterra for $3.4 billion in a deal that will see it become the largest dairy business in Australia.

title.children: Lactalis to purchase Fonterra in mega $3.4b dairy deal

image.altText: A large pallet of tobacco wrapped in plastic wrap sits in the back of a truck.

props.synopsis: Victorian police say the seizure of $7.2 million worth of illicit tobacco is linked to an alleged Iraqi crime syndicate that is laundering money and using to fund serious crimes like aggravated burglaries.

title.children: Illicit tobacco, money laundering funding Victorian burglaries, arsons

image.altText: A black and white photo of a horse behind a gate in a paddock with a shooting star in the top left hand corner of the shot.

props.synopsis: Researchers have vowed to continue their search for a missing bit of space treasure after a meteor fell to Earth two weeks ago.

title.children: Hunt on for valuable meteorite that fell from Victorian night sky

image.altText: South Melbourne FC fans hold up scarves in the stands at an Australia Cup game.

props.synopsis: In a fixture dubbed The Big Show, more than 9,000 screaming fans packed this local football game in a sign these clubs could be ready for the A-League.

title.children: After packing out the 'Big Show', these clubs want a shot in the big leagues

image.altText: Three firefighters outside a building which has orange flames coming from the roof at night.

props.synopsis: Police have charge a 20-year-old man from Melbourne's north over the arson attack in December 2024, which gutted the synagogue in Ripponlea.

title.children: Police charge second man over Melbourne synagogue firebombing

image.altText: A group of nine people standing together with four dogs

props.synopsis: A Melbourne council votes to fence dogs out of a popular reserve to protect wildlife but some locals say it poses a safety risk.

title.children: Council hits pause on dogs in Merri Creek park, sparking safety concerns

image.altText: Close-up of a car exhaust pipe and car exhaust smoke in an urban area.

props.synopsis: Vehicle emissions may contribute to more than 1,800 premature deaths in Australia each year, according to the nation's first assessment of the health impact of traffic-related pollution.

title.children: Car pollution is deadly. New research shows us just how much

image.altText: Izak Rankine, Josh Rachele and Darcy Fogarty walk off

props.synopsis: After a dream home and away season, adversity is officially on Adelaide's doorstep courtesy of Izak Rankine. How the club deals with this will define the current era under Matthew Nicks.

title.children: Rankine saga gives Adelaide its chance to grow from adversity in premiership hunt

image.altText: A man wearing hi-vis top standing beside a sedan. A young woman is sitting on the driver's seat of the car.

props.synopsis:
Victorian man Gavin 'Bear' Hynam lost his eldest son, Preston, in an accident just before his 21st birthday in 2008.

After years of grief, Mr Hynam began channelling his passion for mentoring young people in the local community by fixing pre-loved cars and giving them to disadvantaged youths in and around the regional Victorian town of Horsham.

title.children: Man fixes and gifts cars in son's memory

image.altText: A sheep stands in a pen among others.

props.synopsis: Officers euthanase more than 1,700 sheep and find more than 700 sheep dead on Steven John Ralston's Chinkapook farm within three months.

title.children: Jail for Victorian farmer whose neglect caused death of 2,500 sheep

image.altText: An orange billboard to the left of a service lane

props.synopsis: Victoria's only One Nation MP says she had no idea a billboard her party installed in her electorate would blame the country's rental crisis on high immigration.

title.children: One Nation MP urges party to change billboard message deemed 'hateful'
